rename.to: [ENH] Cleaning up Catch22 feature extraction transformer

body:
There is a group of people working with catch22, including some improvements in pull requests about to be incorporated. We may also in the next days move the repo to an organizational repo. It's in active development.
Note that catch22 is a subset of the larger hctsa (>7k features) set (which is independently being ported to python [here](https://github.com/fairscape/hctsa-py)).

issue.title: [ENH] time series feature sets - transformers

labels.name: interfacing algorithms
labels.description: Interfacing existing algorithms/estimators for other packages

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
From @benfulcher's talk, these are a number of feature sets that would be interesting to explore and possibly to interface as transformers.
Note, not all have a native python implementation, so it is worth exploring how easy/difficult an interface is.

- [ ] tsfel
- [ ] tsfeatures
- [ ] feasts
- [ ] kats feature set
- [ ] catch22 reference implementation, `pycatch22` https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3431
- [ ] htcsa

Related issues:
* `pycatch22` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2254
* `tsfeatures` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/905

body:
@benfulcher, thanks for your excellent presentation!

I opened an umbrella issue with the other feature sets here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2982

Happy to hear there is a Python version of hctsa coming 🙂.

The chlubba/catch22 package is what we originally used in sktime as a soft dependency, but after some issues with differing results by OS and one other issue I can't remember exactly breaking tests, we decided to just re-implement it using numba.

If this has been resolved/people are willing to overlook it, I don't see why we can't reintroduce it as an alternative.

We now have a dedicated python repo: https://github.com/DynamicsAndNeuralSystems/pycatch22. May be best to develop any modifications you require onto this repo for consistency (or to add the OS dependency tests)?

Hm, why not!

Do you want the transformer in `pycatch22`, @benfulcher?
We could make `sktime` a soft dependency, only loaded if someone loads the module where it's in.

> or to add the OS dependency tests

Any plans for CI/CD in the repo?

Being a static feature set, we don't anticipate changes, and are not proficient in implementing CI/CD, so this isn't on the cards.
Not sure why we need the transformer there…? Users can use pycatch22 to simply extract the features, and use a combination workflow with `sktime` to do any extras.

> Being a static feature set, we don't anticipate changes, and are not proficient in implementing CI/CD, so this isn't on the cards.

Yes, but even if it's static, underlying packages could still change their interfaces, or some other python verseion compatibility bug could occur which only solid CI/CD would catch.

Want some help? I'm sure if we try to set up some joint `sktime`/`catch22` event (I haven't been to Sydney yet! 😄 ), there would be people who would join and help with setting up CI/CD.

>Not sure why we need the transformer there…?

A transformer is just the equivalent of wrapping it in a default form with a standardized connector, so you can use it easily as components of more complex algorithms, e.g., classifiers or forecasters.
Why you would want to have a pipeline is I think explained well here on sklearn:
https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/compose.html

In brief, it would help `catch-22` to be used as components of more complex algorithms and workflows easily, and allow people to construct classifiers, clusterers, forecasters, etc.

Yeah of course—if anyone in the community wants to contribute improvements to these open packages, they'd be most welcome. And yes, you're always welcome to visit Sydney Uni :)
And sure, again I'm not able to make it happen, but others are interested, would be happy to have transformer functionality added if this would be helpful to people.
